content: video on hunglish knitter youtube channel to avoid too-tight button band we are using 3 mm needle and pick up stitches as follows pick up 2 stitches then pick the 3rd stitch from sticking through two legs of the next stitch row 1 rs picking up sts row 2 ws slip 1 * p1 k1* row 3 rs work as established row 4 ws work as established row 5 rs work as established row 6 ws work as established row 7 8 9 use three row buttonhole technique row 10 ws work as established row 11 rs work as established row 12 ws work as established row 13 rs bind off three row buttonhole technique row 1 rs work 1st before the marker place the next two sts knitwise yarn over knit next two stitches together row 2 ws on wrong side of work work to location of buttonhole knit the yarn over stitch each time and work through the row row 3 rs on right side of work work to buttonhole purl into the hole below the next stitch repeat at each hole then continue across the row share your version of the hunglish lace tee on my instagram https //www instagram com/hunglishknitter/ happy knitting page 5 of 7 chart legend use charts for guidance to add a new six stitches lace pattern each time you do the raglan increases chart s left front chart s right front chart m left front page 6 of 7 chart m right front chart l xl left front chart xxl right front page 7 of 7
